title: Biden Vows Retribution for Attacks in Kabul, Says ‘We Will Hunt You Down’
sub_head: Deadly blasts killed U.S. servicemembers, Afghans
body:
WASHINGTON—President Biden pledged retribution for the attacks in Afghanistan that killed 12 U.S. servicemembers and dozens of Afghans and promised to continue evacuation efforts.
“We will not forgive. We will not forget. We will hunt you down and make you pay,” Mr. Biden said during remarks at the White House on Thursday evening. He said he had instructed his national security advisers to develop response plans to the attack.
The U.S. evacuation effort will move forward. “We will not be deterred by terrorists,” he said, adding, “We will continue the evacuation.”
Nr. Biden added of the loss of life, “We’re outraged as well as heartbroken.” He called the members of the U.S. military who died and were injured heroes. He added that the situation on the ground remained volatile.
Mr. Biden spent much of Thursday huddled with his national-security advisers and senior aides, clearing his public schedule as an already fraught humanitarian and political crisis worsened when dozens of Afghans and 12 U.S. service members were killed in the blasts outside Kabul’s international airport.
